sentences.english: Worrying is like a rocking chair, it gives you something to do, but it gets you nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 憂慮就像坐在搖椅上，只會原地搖，哪裏也到不了。

sentences.english: Back in the dining-room she sat in her chair and rocked.
sentences.chinese: 她回到餐室，坐在搖椅裏搖了起來。

sentences.english: He wiped his hands on his trousers and plunked himself down in a rocking chair.
sentences.chinese: 他在褲子上擦了擦手，然後一下子坐進搖椅裏面。

sentences.english: The lawyer was sitting in a rocking chair beside the coffin, his head thrown back and his eyes closed.
sentences.chinese: 律師坐在靈柩邊的一把搖椅裏，仰着頭，閉着眼。

sentences.english: Grandmother finds it relaxing to sit in her rocking chair and move back and forth.
sentences.chinese: 奶奶發現坐在搖椅上前後搖晃還挺舒服的。

sentences.english: Jamie sat in the rocking chair.
Worry is like a rocking chair.
Dad was sitting in his rocker, a huge grin on his face.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸坐在他的搖椅上，咧開大嘴笑着。

sentences.english: He could sit in his rocking-chair and read.
sentences.chinese: 他可以坐在搖椅裏看報紙。

sentences.english: Can you still recall your grandfather’s rocking chair?
sentences.chinese: 你還能記起你祖父的搖椅嗎？

sentences.english: Judith was sitting in a rocking-chair by the window.
sentences.chinese: 朱迪絲正坐在窗戶邊的一張搖椅裏。

sentences.english: He rocked back and forth in his rocking chair.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在搖椅裏前後搖晃着。

sentences.english: She wants to remodel her house and garden and sit on one of the white rockers on her front porch.
sentences.chinese: 她想重裝房子和花園，也想在門前白色的搖椅上休息。

sentences.english: The gentleman is sitting in the rocking-chair smoking a cigar.
sentences.chinese: 那位紳士坐在搖椅裏抽一支雪茄。

sentences.english: It was a little after seven when he stopped and settled back into his rocking chair.
sentences.chinese: 七點多時，他停了下來，坐回了搖椅。

sentences.english: As they thickened, he leaned his head back against the rocking chair.
sentences.chinese: 隨着雲彩慢慢變厚，他將頭又靠向了搖椅。

definition: to swallow clouds and blow out fog (idiom)/to blow cigarette or opium smoke
summer sleeping mat (e.g. of woven split bamboo)/CL:張|张[zhang1],領|领[ling3]
head of a flight of stairs
